messages.subject: Re: Taping ex-husbands phone calls
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/28/99 11:58:21 AM Central Daylight Time, LifesLearn@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/28/99 11:58:21 AM Central Daylight Time,
LifesLearn@... writes:

<< a know, I would send in a copy of the tapes when I wrote the letter to
FOC.
JUST A COPY! Let natural curosity hit them and do the work. I would write in
a letter that *Name* is doing this, this, this, and this. Here is a copy of
ONE of the tapes I have that shows that these are disruptive and insulting.
I
would like to know what i am to do in the event that one of my children be
present when I review messages on my machine.
Ask and ye shall receive??? Just sqeak those wheels until FOC comes along
andgreases them in a acceptable manner! >>


Stephanie,
I really do like this idea!! Thanks.
Tami

messages.subject: Re: Taping ex-husbands phone calls
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/28/1999 3:09:28 AM !!!First Boot!!!, FreeSchool@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/28/1999 3:09:28 AM !!!First Boot!!!, FreeSchool@...
writes:

<< Stephanie,
Well she has let him know that he is leaving these messages on the
answering machine and that that means she has tapes of his behavior. He
says
that he doesn't care. When he blows up like that, he just wants her to know
how he feels, and he doesn't care who else hears them. He even thinks that
other listeners will agree with him about what he is saying! The guy is
truly amazing!!!NOT
Tami >>
Ya know, I would send in a copy of the tapes when I wrote the letter to FOC.
JUST A COPY! Let natural curosity hit them and do the work. I would write in
a letter that *Name* is doing this, this, this, and this. Here is a copy of
ONE of the tapes I have that shows that these are disruptive and insulting. I
would like to know what i am to do in the event that one of my children be
present when I review messages on my machine.
Ask and ye shall receive??? Just sqeak those wheels until FOC comes along
andgreases them in a acceptable manner!
Stepanie

messages.subject: Re: Taping ex-husbands phone calls
messages.msgSnippet: For some reason I was reminded of that case where the ex-wife killed her ex-husband and his new wife.  Bamberek or something like that.  Tapes of her phone
messages.messageBody:
For some reason I was reminded of that case where the ex-wife killed her
ex-husband and his new wife. Bamberek or something like that. Tapes of her
phone calls and phone messages were used in court against her.

Love,
Jill

messages.subject: Re: Taping ex-husbands phone calls
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/27/99 10:34:25 AM Central Daylight Time, LifesLearn@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/27/99 10:34:25 AM Central Daylight Time,
LifesLearn@... writes:

<< < I believe it is a violation of someone's privacy rights to tape them
without
their consent.... but I'm not a lawyer, so look for a source of better
information. I don't think you would be able to admit the tapes as
evidence. >>
Ahha! This could very well be true. The thing to do is to get on tape with
him, and plainly state, *Name*, I am taping this and all telephone
conversations that are happening. That is what I did to my exhusband. He
sotpped calling for a time. >>

Stephanie,
Well she has let him know that he is leaving these messages on the
answering machine and that that means she has tapes of his behavior. He says
that he doesn't care. When he blows up like that, he just wants her to know
how he feels, and he doesn't care who else hears them. He even thinks that
other listeners will agree with him about what he is saying! The guy is
truly amazing!!!NOT
Tami
